Title: Mechanisms of Attention in ADHD: A fMRI Study
SpecificAim1: Characterize Attention alterations in ADHD using fMRI
SpecificAim2: Manipulate Prefrontal Cortex activity and measure effects on Attention
SpecificAim3: Establish translational relevance through Biomarker level measures
Innovation: First application of fMRI to study Attention in ADHD
Significance: Addresses critical gap in understanding ADHD mechanisms
Approach: n=97 Human participants, Between-subjects RCT, fMRI, EEG system
PI_Background: Expertise in fMRI and ADHD research
Timeline: Pilot: 2 months, Main: 9 months, Analysis: 4 months
ExpectedOutcomes: 3-5 publications, preliminary data for R01, potential biomarkers

Title: Mechanisms of Working Memory in Depression: A fMRI Study
SpecificAim1: Characterize Working Memory alterations in Depression using fMRI
SpecificAim2: Manipulate Prefrontal Cortex activity and measure effects on Working Memory
SpecificAim3: Establish translational relevance through Behavioral score measures
Innovation: First application of fMRI to study Working Memory in Depression
Significance: Addresses critical gap in understanding Depression mechanisms
Approach: n=246 Sprague-Dawley rats, Longitudinal, fMRI, Behavioral setup
PI_Background: Expertise in fMRI and Depression research
Timeline: Pilot: 2 months, Main: 8 months, Analysis: 4 months
ExpectedOutcomes: 3-5 publications, preliminary data for R01, potential biomarkers

Title: Mechanisms of Working Memory in ADHD: A fMRI Study
SpecificAim1: Characterize Working Memory alterations in ADHD using fMRI
SpecificAim2: Manipulate Prefrontal Cortex activity and measure effects on Working Memory
SpecificAim3: Establish translational relevance through Connectivity measure measures
Innovation: First application of fMRI to study Working Memory in ADHD
Significance: Addresses critical gap in understanding ADHD mechanisms
Approach: n=246 C57BL/6 mice, Longitudinal, fMRI, Histology lab
PI_Background: Expertise in fMRI and ADHD research
Timeline: Pilot: 2 months, Main: 11 months, Analysis: 4 months
ExpectedOutcomes: 3-5 publications, preliminary data for R01, potential biomarkers
